pullRequest.body:
If two a.e.-measurable functions `Œ± √ó Œ≤ ‚Üí ‚Ñù‚â•0‚àû` with finite integrals have the same integral on every rectangle, then they are almost everywhere equal.
The new result puts together the fact that a.e.-equality can be proven from equality of integrals, and induction over the pi-system of rectangles.

---

Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:

- ...

Deletions:

- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they

### PR summary [a8bff698a7](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/22764/commits/a8bff698a74ebfd2790509d61636a7442184dfbf)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ ae_eq_of_setLIntegral_prod_eq`
`+ lintegral_eq_lintegral_of_isPiSystem`
`+ lintegral_eq_lintegral_of_isPiSystem_of_univ_mem`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by EtienneC30.
Maybe change the name of the sets `f` because it conflicts with the function.

This closes it.
```suggestion
    simp_rw [lintegral_iUnion hfm hfd, h]
```

You can drop the `simp` here, as you wish.
```suggestion
  ¬∑ exact ‚ü®Set.univ, .univ, Set.univ, .univ, Set.univ_prod_univ‚ü©
```

Why did you choose implicit parameters for the sets here? Maybe semi-implicit is better.
```suggestion
    (h : ‚àÄ ‚¶És : Set Œ±‚¶Ñ (_ : MeasurableSet s) ‚¶Ét : Set Œ≤‚¶Ñ (_ : MeasurableSet t),
      ‚à´‚Åª x in s √óÀ¢ t, f x ‚àÇŒº = ‚à´‚Åª x in s √óÀ¢ t, g x ‚àÇŒº) :
```
Do we need this specialization for measurable functions? The aemeasurable version seems enough to me.
The whole file has that duplication of aemeasurable vs measurable, and I followed it. But I agree it's a bit silly. I removed that measurable version.
Given `h_univ` and `hf_int`, can't you drop `hg_int`? Same thing below.

pullRequest.title: feat(MeasureTheory): a.e. equality on product space from equality of integrals

source.title: feat(Probability): Radon-Nikodym derivative of the posterior kernel
